poem:
"Digital Nostalgia"

In the machine heart, 
a revival of pixels,
the echo of lost youth.
Nintendo's ghost beckons
amid glowing reviews—
old games reborn, anew.

Fizzing through wires,
wisps of former selves take hold, 
in the palms of remembrance.

An App, a Delta, a river
of old circuits singing -
it is yesterday,
once more ensnared within
the pocket's heft.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Pushing Buttons: The emulator app helping gamers replay classics from their youth – for now A new app has been at the top of the charts on Apple’s store for a couple of weeks now: Delta. Its app store page is illustrated with shots of very Nintendo-esque on-screen controls, framing screenshots from Game Boy, Snes and Mega Drive games. The reviews are glowing: “I’ve been downloading tons of games I played when I was a". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
